title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks - BBC News
summary: a man 's been jailed for breaking into an elderly couple 's home and beating a woman with a metal bar along with three other attackers .
an election candidate fails in his high court bid to declare mid beds mp nadine dorries ' victory invalid .
luton council says there 's a severe housing shortage in the area as a disabled woman reveals she 's being housed in a travelodge .
more news , sport , weather and travel updates from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: good night from us
text: that 's all from us today on local live .
we 'll be back with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from 08:00 tomorrow .
if you missed us at all today , here 's a round-up of our top stories :

documents.title: stockwood park in luton
text: a carved owl in stockwood park , luton is the main image for today 's local live page .
the owl is one of several carvings along the road towards the
what are your favourite places in the three counties ?
it would be great if you could
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: showers easing tonight for sunny spells tomorrow
text: there 's the chance of an isolated shower tonight but otherwise staying dry with clear skies .
feeling chilly though , with lows of 7c ( 45f ) .
tomorrow will be a fine and dry day , with pleasant spells of sunshine and light winds .
feeling warmer than of late with the highest temperatures of 21c ( 70f ) towards st albans .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: greg rutherford in stockholm event
text: olympic champion greg rutherford is among the british athletes in action at the diamond league event in stockholm this evening .
the milton keynes long jumper is aiming to improve on his third place at last weekend 's anniversary games in london .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: elderly woman beaten by gang sees them jailed
text: an elderly woman who was woken with a hand over her mouth last july and then beaten with a metal bar has seen her attackers jailed .
varna fisher , 81 , from welwyn garden city , tried to push a panic alarm but the gang snatched it away .
four men have been jailed for the attack , including darren lewis , 35 , from croydon .
he was passed a life sentence with a minimum term of 15 years today at st albans crown court .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: queuing traffic on the m25
text: there are long queues on all approaches to j25 on the m25 .
roads are looking busy elsewhere , particularly around watford - check your journey
no reports of any issues on trains .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: seagull snatches bletchley man 's phone
text: a man from bletchley has had his mobile phone stolen by a seagull - the latest victim in an increasing number of reported seagull attacks .
darryl gatland was taking a photo out of his hotel window in cornwall , when the bird snatched his £ 500 iphone 5 .
`` [ this was ] quite bold actually , he probably thought it was something nice to eat '' , peter rock , an urban gull specialist ,
`` gulls are not getting more aggressive , it 's just that there are more of them and as you can imagine , the more gulls there are , the more incidents you 'd expect . ''
author: Roberto Perrone
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: if you 're just catching up
text: the top stories we 're looking at :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: nadine dorries ' statement on high court action
text: the mp for mid bedfordshire , nadine dorries , has released a statement on
`` this petition was part of mr ireland 's continued campaign of harassment against our client '' , says the statement prepared by ms dorries ' solicitors .
`` our client believes that the petition was maliciously brought and had no merit .
we are pleased that the right outcome , namely dismissal of the petition , was achieved . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: schoolboys called up to international training camps
text: two schoolboys from the luton town football academy have been called up to international training camps .
jeevan panesar is to go to the scottish under-15s camp .
kitan sorunke has been asked to attend a nigerian under 17s camp .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: filming at wrest park
text: there is some rather high profile filming going on at wrest park in bedfordshire today by the looks of things .
crews have kept details under their hats and told visitors to simply `` watch television this winter '' .
having a quick look at twitter , there are rumours that it 's to do with programme the royals and that liz hurley might be there answers on a postcard !
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: milton keynes sculpture unveiled today
text: a sculpture symbolising the aftermath of war is being unveiled at campbell park in milton keynes today .
it 's being dedicated to the life of edna read , who helped promote the arts in the new city , but lost her life in a car crash in 2012 .
edna was a well-known pacifist and had donated a sculpture called after hiroshima to the buddhist temple at willen .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: severe housing shortage in luton , council says
text: after a young woman from luton spoke out about being

a spokesman from the council told us staff were `` working hard to address the supply and demand problem '' , which was partly down to a gap between housing benefit rates and landlords ' rent demands .
`` our priority is to secure accommodation which prevents a crisis for the imminently homeless family , '' the spokesman added .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: missing teen from high wycombe found
text: police say a teenage girl missing from high wycombe has been found safe and well .
they 're thanking the public and the media for their help in tracing 18-year-old hafsah ilyas .

documents.title: steep bill for mid beds mp challenge
text: i 've been at the high court today where an election candidate has lost his bid to have nadine dorries ' victory declared void .
independent tim ireland accused the conservative mp for mid bedfordshire of making `` false statements '' about his `` personal character and conduct '' .
as well as having his case thrown out , i understand mr ireland has been presented with a cost bill of about £ 150,000 .
no comment yet from ms dorries but her friends tell me she 's very relieved that this is all over .
author: Andrew Sinclair
Political correspondent, BBC East

documents.title: disabled couple living at toddington services
text: a disabled couple from luton have been moved into a hotel in toddington services because the council could n't find them a suitable house .

janet paddison , 23 , who suffers with fibromyalgia , lived in a rented property with her partner , her daughter and an assistance dog until march last year and has been unable to find private accommodation .
ms paddison says the council has had long enough to organise suitable living arrangements for her , but she but was moved into a travelodge on tuesday .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: dorries court challenge thrown out
text: the high court has thrown out an attempt to force a re-run of the general election in mid bedfordshire .
independent candidate tim ireland , who stood against the conservative mp nadine dorries , sought to have the election declared void because he claimed she 'd made disparaging comments about him .
the request for a full hearing into the affair was thrown out on the grounds mr ireland had been slow to serve court papers .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: news so far this afternoon :
text: the top stories this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: gang jailed for terrorising couple
text: a gang of four men have been jailed for terrorising an elderly couple in hertfordshire after breaking into their home last july .
the gang travelled from south london to the house in welwyn garden city after being tipped-off by a carer who had worked with varna and mortimer fisher that there was cash in the bedroom .
darren lewis , 35 ( left ) , marvin semper , 30 ( middle ) , clinton jackson , 25 ( bottom right ) , jermaine kellman , 29 ( top right ) were all found guilty of aggravated burglary .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: update on the roads
text: the m1 exit slip road on the northbound carriageway at j14 is partially blocked because of a broken down vehicle .
elsewhere , certain roads in the three counties are looking more congested than usual - check your journey
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: school pupils win video award
text: did you used to let your imagination run wild in maths lessons in school ?
a group of children from st matthew 's primary school in luton do it seems , as it 's the topic of their film
`` we learnt a lot of skills doing this like stop animation , filming and acting '' , kenza , who appears in the video ,
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: mid beds challenge thrown out of court
text: the high court has thrown out attempt to force a re-run of an election in mid bedfordshire .
conservative mp for for the area , nadine dorries , challenged claims that she breached the law during the general election .
one of her opponents , tim ireland , who stood as an independent , said she made unfair allegations about him during the campaign .
author: Andrew Sinclair
Political correspondent, BBC East

documents.title: if you 're just joining us
text: top stories for beds , herts and bucks this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: wardown park bridge set to re-open
text: a victorian suspension bridge in wardown park in luton will be officially re-opened this afternoon after an extensive four-month repair and renovation operation costing about £ 300,000 .
the bridge has been a central feature of the park since the early 1900s and is reported to be shortest single span suspension bridge in the country .
luton borough council said the bridge was taken out of operation following health and safety concerns associated with structural maintenance issues .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: penn school : 'assume it wo n't re-open '
text: the trustees of a buckinghamshire special school threatened with closure have said `` parents should work on the assumption the school will not re-open '' .
trustees released a statement after pressure from angry parents of children who attend penn school near high wycombe , who believed there was a 31 july deadline for new buyers to come forward .
the statement said there was no deadline to find a new buyer and parents `` need to find an alternative school for their child '' .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: elderly couple too terrified to return home
text: a gang from south london who broke in to an elderly couple 's home in welwyn garden city left them too terrified to return .
four masked men used a metal bar to attack varna fisher , 81 , in the home she shared with her husband mortimer , 85 , who died three months after the incident in july last year .
one man was jailed for life today and at an earlier hearing at the old bailey , marvin semper , 30 , and his brother jermaine kellman , 29 , were sentenced to 13 years for aggravated burglary .
a fourth man , clinton jackson , 25 , denied the charge but was jailed for 18 years .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: family left with lots of work after car smashes porch
text: a family whose porch was smashed off the front of their house after a driver veered off the road say they have they have a
author: Herts Advertiser

documents.title: good spells of sunshine this afternoon
text: it will be a largely bright afternoon with good spells of sunshine .
however , a scattering of showers will once again develop with perhaps the odd heavier one around , especially over higher ground such as the chilterns .
feeling warmer with light winds maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: penn school : trustees statement
text: the trustees of a buckinghamshire special school threatened with closure have released a statement after pressure from angry parents .
penn school 's trustees say parents were n't told sooner of the decision to close in case children were pulled out of school and the situation was made worse .
`` of course we would n't have walked away '' , said parent amanda burgess .
`` we all fought so hard to get our children into that school . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: man jailed for beating elderly woman with metal bar
text: a man who was part of gang that broke into an elderly couple 's home and beat a woman with a metal bar has been jailed for life .
darren lewis , 35 , of napier road , croydon , broke into the home of varna and mortimer fisher on 30 july last year along with three masked men .
they 'd been tipped off that mrs fisher , 81 , kept money under her pillow .
appearing at st albans crown court ( today , lewis was jailed for life and will serve a minimum term of 15 years .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: soldier letters reveal ww1 strategies
text: letters written by a bedford soldier and

the personal notes penned by major john montgomery - which relate to the campaign in south west africa - refer to `` patrolling one of the hottest places '' and how `` most of the wells had been poisoned '' .
they have been released by the
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: nadine dorries : mp in court today
text: the conservative mp for mid bedfordshire , nadine dorries , is challenging claims she breached the law during the general election .
one of her opponents , tim ireland , who stood as an independent , says she made unfair allegations about him during the campaign .
the civil action will be heard at the high court in london today .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: men charged after incident at watford jewellers
text: two men have been charged with burglary after an incident at a jewellers in watford on tuesday .

det insp jason keane from hertfordshire police said witnesses described seeing people allegedly entering the shopping centre from the queens road entrance at about 09:50 on bikes and foot , armed with `` large sledgehammers '' .
the two men who have been charged in connection with the incident will appear before hatfield remand court today .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: parents hope hospital review will help others
text: the parents of one of five new-born babies to die at milton keynes hospital within eight months say they hope the findings of a review will improve things for other families .
jonathan and kirsty stansfield lost their son george in december 2013 , but only found out six months later it was down to hospital mistakes not natural causes .
following the independent external review , which
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel update : m25 queues
text: traffic is queuing for seven miles on the anti-clockwise m25 between j24 for potters bar and j23 for the a1 ( m ) due to an earlier accident .
all lanes have been re-opened but congestion is back to j25 for the a10 .
get the latest updates form
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: teenager from high wycombe missing
text: a missing teenager who was last seen leaving her home in high wycombe on tuesday is being urged to make contact with police or her family .
hafsah ilyas , 18 , was last seen at about 20:20 leaving her home in brunel road wearing a purple dress with black trousers underneath .
hafsah is 5ft 4in tall , of medium build and has long , dark brown hair , which police say may be worn up .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: duke of kent visits bletchley park
text: hrh the duke of kent , bletchley park 's royal patron , officially opened a
the duke met `` the road to bletchley park '' design team and was escorted around by bletchley park trust chairman and ceo iain standen .

part of the exhibition is about two secret organisations set up by the armed forces to allow the government code and cypher school ( gc & cs ) to `` hit the ground running '' at the outbreak of war in 1939 .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: link road work delayed by trespassers
text: work on the new woodside link road in bedfordshire is being disrupted on an almost daily basis by off-road bikers .
bedfordshire police officers confirmed they had been called to the area a few times and are `` doing what they can '' .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: milton keynes hospital reassures pregnant women
text: milton keynes hospital is reassuring pregnant women it is a safe place to give birth after five deaths over a period of eight months between 2013 and 2014 .

the hospital said the deaths had been the subject of `` extensive internal and external investigation and scrutiny '' to establish how and why each death happened and had made `` significant improvements and changes to working practices '' as a result .

medical director , professor martin wetherill , said : `` i believe we have been open and honest with the families involved about any failings identified in their care and we have made extensive changes to the way we work to prevent such failings happening again i hope there may be some solace in knowing that we have , and continue to improve and develop our obstetric and maternity service to ensure it is among the safest in the country . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel update : accident on a1 and m1 disruption
text: one lane is blocked on the southbound a1 ( m ) between j7 for the a602 at stevenage and j6 for the a1000 at welwyn due to an accident involving four cars .
there 's also disruption on the northbound m1 between j11 for dunstable and j12 for flitwick due to a broken down car .

text: police have described motorists who filmed the aftermath of yesterday morning 's fatal crash on the m1 near milton keynes as disrespectful .
a 35-year-old woman from bedford was killed in a collision involving four cars and an hgv on the northbound carriageway just before 08:00 .
a 55-year-old man from warwickshire was arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving .
